title: Madame Sata 2002 DVDRip Sonata Premiere
description:
A story inspired by the life of one of the most remarkable figures in Brazilian popular culture, JoÃƒÂ£o Francisco dos Santos (1900-1976). In turn, bandit, transvestite, street fighter, brothel cook, convict and father to seven adopted children, dos Santos--better known as Madame SatÃƒÂ£--was also a notorious gay performer who pushed social boundaries in a volatile time. The story begins in 1932, in Rio de Janeiro's bohemian Lapa district, when JoÃƒÂ£o Francisco is about to achieve his dream: becoming a stage star. In the sordid yet lively world of Lapa--populated by pimps, prostitutes and other denizens of Rio's underworld--JoÃƒÂ£o battles the streets and presides over a surrogate family that includes the charming prostitute Laurita, and her baby daughter whom everyone dotes on; the flamboyant hustler Taboo; JoÃƒÂ£o's teenage lover, Renatinho; and Amador, the owner of the Blue Danube club which is their second home.
